trans-unit.source: 'DiagnosticDescriptor' assigned to field is used to report a compilation end diagnostic, but the 'DiagnosticDescriptor' constructor used to initialize it does not pass in the required custom tag "CompilationEnd". See documentation for 'WellKnownDiagnosticTags.CompilationEnd' for details.

trans-unit.source: This C# compiler extension should not be implemented in an assembly containing a reference to Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic. The Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic assembly is not always provided during C# compilation scenarios, so references to it could cause the compiler extension to behave unpredictably.
trans-unit.target: This C# compiler extension should not be implemented in an assembly containing a reference to Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic. The Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic assembly is not always provided during C# compilation scenarios, so references to it could cause the compiler extension to behave unpredictably.

trans-unit.source: This compiler extension should not be implemented in an assembly with target framework '{0}'. References to other target frameworks will cause the compiler to behave unpredictably.
trans-unit.target: This compiler extension should not be implemented in an assembly with target framework '{0}'. References to other target frameworks will cause the compiler to behave unpredictably.

trans-unit.source: Types which implement compiler extension points should only be declared in assemblies targeting netstandard2.0. More specific target frameworks are only available in a subset of supported compilation scenarios, so targeting them may cause the feature to behave unpredictably.
trans-unit.target: Types which implement compiler extension points should only be declared in assemblies targeting netstandard2.0. More specific target frameworks are only available in a subset of supported compilation scenarios, so targeting them may cause the feature to behave unpredictably.

trans-unit.target: Compiler extensions should be implemented in assemblies targeting netstandard2.0

trans-unit.source: This compiler extension should not be implemented in an assembly containing a reference to Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspaces. trans-unit.target: This compiler extension should not be implemented in an assembly containing a reference to Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspaces. trans-unit.source: This Visual Basic compiler extension should not be implemented in an assembly containing a reference to Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp. The Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp assembly is not always provided during Visual Basic compilation scenarios, so references to it could cause the compiler extension to behave unpredictably.
trans-unit.target: This Visual Basic compiler extension should not be implemented in an assembly containing a reference to Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp. trans-unit.source: Types which implement compiler extension points should not be declared in assemblies that contain references to assemblies which are not provided by all compilation scenarios. Doing so may cause the feature to behave unpredictably.
trans-unit.target: Types which implement compiler extension points should not be declared in assemblies that contain references to assemblies which are not provided by all compilation scenarios. Doing so may cause the feature to behave unpredictably.

trans-unit.source: Compiler extensions should be implemented in assemblies with compiler-provided references
trans-unit.target: Compiler extensions should be implemented in assemblies with compiler-provided references

trans-unit.source: 'GetSemanticModel' is an expensive method to invoke within a diagnostic analyzer because it creates a completely new semantic model, which does not share compilation data with the compiler or other analyzers. This incurs an additional performance cost during semantic analysis. Instead, consider registering a different analyzer action which allows used of a shared 'SemanticModel', such as 'RegisterOperationAction', 'RegisterSyntaxNodeAction', or 'RegisterSemanticModelAction'.
trans-unit.target: 'GetSemanticModel' is an expensive method to invoke within a diagnostic analyzer because it creates a completely new semantic model, which does not share compilation data with the compiler or other analyzers. This incurs an additional performance cost during semantic analysis. Instead, consider registering a different analyzer action which allows used of a shared 'SemanticModel', such as 'RegisterOperationAction', 'RegisterSyntaxNodeAction', or 'RegisterSemanticModelAction'.

trans-unit.source: DiagnosticAnalyzer's language-specific Register methods, such as RegisterSyntaxNodeAction, RegisterCodeBlockStartAction and RegisterCodeBlockEndAction, expect a language-specific 'SyntaxKind' type argument for it's '{0}' type parameter. Otherwise, the registered analyzer action can never be invoked during analysis.
trans-unit.target: DiagnosticAnalyzer's language-specific Register methods, such as RegisterSyntaxNodeAction, RegisterCodeBlockStartAction and RegisterCodeBlockEndAction, expect a language-specific 'SyntaxKind' type argument for it's '{0}' type parameter. Otherwise, the registered analyzer action can never be invoked during analysis.

trans-unit.source: Start action has no registered non-end actions
trans-unit.target: Start action has no registered non-end actions

trans-unit.target: '{0}' does not register any analyzer actions. Consider moving actions registered in '{1}' that depend on this start action to '{0}'.

trans-unit.source: Start action has no registered actions
trans-unit.target: Start action has no registered actions

trans-unit.source: '{0}' does not register any analyzer actions, except for a '{1}'. Consider replacing this start/end action pair with a '{2}' or moving actions registered in '{3}' that depend on this start action to '{0}'.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' does not register any analyzer actions, except for a '{1}'. Consider replacing this start/end action pair with a '{2}' or moving actions registered in '{3}' that depend on this start action to '{0}'.

trans-unit.source: An analyzer start action enables performing stateful analysis over a given code unit, such as a code block, compilation, etc. Careful design is necessary to achieve efficient analyzer execution without memory leaks. Use the following guidelines for writing such analyzers: 1. Define a new scope for the registered start action, possibly with a private nested type for analyzing each code unit. 2. If required, define and initialize state in the start action. 3. Register at least one non-end action that refers to this state in the start action. If no such action is necessary, consider replacing the start action with a non-start action. For example, a CodeBlockStartAction with no registered actions or only a registered CodeBlockEndAction should be replaced with a CodeBlockAction. 4. If required, register an end action to report diagnostics based on the final state.
trans-unit.target: An analyzer start action enables performing stateful analysis over a given code unit, such as a code block, compilation, etc. Careful design is necessary to achieve efficient analyzer execution without memory leaks. Use the following guidelines for writing such analyzers: 1. Define a new scope for the registered start action, possibly with a private nested type for analyzing each code unit. 2. If required, define and initialize state in the start action. 3. Register at least one non-end action that refers to this state in the start action. If no such action is necessary, consider replacing the start action with a non-start action. For example, a CodeBlockStartAction with no registered actions or only a registered CodeBlockEndAction should be replaced with a CodeBlockAction. 4. If required, register an end action to report diagnostics based on the final state.

trans-unit.source: Ensure up-to-date entry for analyzer diagnostic IDs are added to analyzer release.
trans-unit.target: Ensure up-to-date entry for analyzer diagnostic IDs are added to analyzer release.

trans-unit.source: Rule '{0}' has a changed 'Category' or 'Severity' from the last release. Either revert the update(s) in source or add a new up-to-date entry to unshipped release file.
trans-unit.target: Rule '{0}' has a changed 'Category' or 'Severity' from the last release. Either revert the update(s) in source or add a new up-to-date entry to unshipped release file.

trans-unit.source: Ensure up-to-date entry for analyzer diagnostic IDs are added to analyzer release
trans-unit.target: Ensure up-to-date entry for analyzer diagnostic IDs are added to analyzer release

trans-unit.source: Update rule entry in unshipped release file
trans-unit.target: Update rule entry in unshipped release file

trans-unit.source: Consider providing localizable arguments of type '{0}' to diagnostic descriptor constructor to ensure the descriptor is localizable
trans-unit.target: Consider providing localizable arguments of type '{0}' to diagnostic descriptor constructor to ensure the descriptor is localizable

trans-unit.source: Provide localizable arguments to diagnostic descriptor constructor
trans-unit.target: Provide localizable arguments to diagnostic descriptor constructor

trans-unit.source: If your diagnostic analyzer and it's reported diagnostics need to be localizable, then the supported DiagnosticDescriptors used for constructing the diagnostics must also be localizable. If so, then localizable argument(s) must be provided for parameter 'title' (and optionally 'description') to the diagnostic descriptor constructor to ensure that the descriptor is localizable.
trans-unit.target: If your diagnostic analyzer and it's reported diagnostics need to be localizable, then the supported DiagnosticDescriptors used for constructing the diagnostics must also be localizable. If so, then localizable argument(s) must be provided for parameter 'title' (and optionally 'description') to the diagnostic descriptor constructor to ensure that the descriptor is localizable.

trans-unit.source: Avoid storing per-compilation data of type '{0}' into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer
trans-unit.target: Avoid storing per-compilation data of type '{0}' into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer

trans-unit.source: Avoid storing per-compilation data into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer
trans-unit.target: Avoid storing per-compilation data into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer

trans-unit.source: Instance of a diagnostic analyzer might outlive the lifetime of compilation. Hence, storing per-compilation data, such as symbols, into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer might cause stale compilations to stay alive and cause memory leaks. Instead, you should store this data on a separate type instantiated in a compilation start action, registered using '{0}.{1}' API. An instance of this type will be created per-compilation and it won't outlive compilation's lifetime, hence avoiding memory leaks.
trans-unit.target: Instance of a diagnostic analyzer might outlive the lifetime of compilation. Hence, storing per-compilation data, such as symbols, into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer might cause stale compilations to stay alive and cause memory leaks. Instead, you should store this data on a separate type instantiated in a compilation start action, registered using '{0}.{1}' API. An instance of this type will be created per-compilation and it won't outlive compilation's lifetime, hence avoiding memory leaks.

trans-unit.source: The author of this interface did not intend to have third party implementations of this interface and reserves the right to change it. Implementing this interface could therefore result in a source or binary compatibility issue with a future version of this interface.
trans-unit.target: The author of this interface did not intend to have third party implementations of this interface and reserves the right to change it. Implementing this interface could therefore result in a source or binary compatibility issue with a future version of this interface.

trans-unit.source: Type {0} cannot implement interface {1} because {1} is not available for public implementation
trans-unit.target: Type {0} cannot implement interface {1} because {1} is not available for public implementation

trans-unit.source: Only internal implementations of this interface are allowed
trans-unit.target: Only internal implementations of this interface are allowed

trans-unit.source: A CodeFixProvider that intends to support fix all occurrences must classify the registered code actions into equivalence classes by assigning it an explicit, non-null equivalence key which is unique for each kind of code action created by this fixer. This enables the FixAllProvider to fix all diagnostics in the required scope by applying code actions from this fixer that are in the equivalence class of the trigger code action.
trans-unit.target: A CodeFixProvider that intends to support fix all occurrences must classify the registered code actions into equivalence classes by assigning it an explicit, non-null equivalence key which is unique for each kind of code action created by this fixer. This enables the FixAllProvider to fix all diagnostics in the required scope by applying code actions from this fixer that are in the equivalence class of the trigger code action.

trans-unit.source: Provide an explicit argument for optional parameter '{0}', which is non-null and unique for each kind of code action created by this fixer
trans-unit.target: Provide an explicit argument for optional parameter '{0}', which is non-null and unique for each kind of code action created by this fixer

trans-unit.source: Create code actions should have a unique EquivalenceKey for FixAll occurrences support
trans-unit.target: Create code actions should have a unique EquivalenceKey for FixAll occurrences support

trans-unit.source: '{0}' has the default value of 'null' for property '{1}'. Either override this property on '{0}' to return a non-null and unique value across all code actions per-fixer or use such an existing code action.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' has the default value of 'null' for property '{1}'. Either override this property on '{0}' to return a non-null and unique value across all code actions per-fixer or use such an existing code action.

trans-unit.source: Use code actions that have a unique EquivalenceKey for FixAll occurrences support
trans-unit.target: Use code actions that have a unique EquivalenceKey for FixAll occurrences support

trans-unit.source: Many objects exposed by Roslyn are immutable. The return value from a method invocation on these objects should not be ignored.
trans-unit.target: Many objects exposed by Roslyn are immutable. The return value from a method invocation on these objects should not be ignored.

trans-unit.source: '{0}' is immutable and '{1}' will not have any effect on it. Consider using the return value from '{1}'.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' is immutable and '{1}' will not have any effect on it. Consider using the return value from '{1}'.

trans-unit.source: Do not ignore values returned by methods on immutable objects
trans-unit.target: Do not ignore values returned by methods on immutable objects

trans-unit.source: Code fix providers should provide FixAll support
trans-unit.target: Code fix providers should provide FixAll support

trans-unit.source: '{0}' registers one or more code fixes, but does not override the method 'CodeFixProvider.GetFixAllProvider'. Override this method and provide a non-null FixAllProvider for FixAll support, potentially 'WellKnownFixAllProviders.BatchFixer', or 'null' to explicitly disable FixAll support.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' registers one or more code fixes, but does not override the method 'CodeFixProvider.GetFixAllProvider'. Override this method and provide a non-null FixAllProvider for FixAll support, potentially 'WellKnownFixAllProviders.BatchFixer', or 'null' to explicitly disable FixAll support.

trans-unit.source: A CodeFixProvider should provide FixAll support to enable users to fix multiple instances of the underlying diagnostic with a single code fix. See documentation at https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/blob/main/docs/analyzers/FixAllProvider.md for further details.
trans-unit.target: A CodeFixProvider should provide FixAll support to enable users to fix multiple instances of the underlying diagnostic with a single code fix. See documentation at https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/blob/main/docs/analyzers/FixAllProvider.md for further details.

trans-unit.source: Override GetFixAllProvider.
trans-unit.target: Override GetFixAllProvider.

trans-unit.source: Consider providing a non-null 'helpLinkUri' to diagnostic descriptor constructor to show information when this diagnostic appears in the error list
trans-unit.target: Consider providing a non-null 'helpLinkUri' to diagnostic descriptor constructor to show information when this diagnostic appears in the error list

trans-unit.source: Provide non-null 'helpLinkUri' value to diagnostic descriptor constructor
trans-unit.target: Provide non-null 'helpLinkUri' value to diagnostic descriptor constructor

trans-unit.source: The 'helpLinkUri' value is used to show information when this diagnostic in the error list. Every analyzer should have a helpLinkUri specified which points to a help page that does not change over time.
trans-unit.target: The 'helpLinkUri' value is used to show information when this diagnostic in the error list. Every analyzer should have a helpLinkUri specified which points to a help page that does not change over time.

trans-unit.source: DiagnosticId for analyzers must be in specified format
trans-unit.target: DiagnosticId for analyzers must be in specified format

trans-unit.target: Diagnostic Id '{0}' belonging to category '{1}' is not in the required range and/or format '{2}' specified in the file '{3}'

trans-unit.target: DiagnosticId for analyzers must be in specified format.

trans-unit.source: DiagnosticId must be unique across analyzers
trans-unit.target: DiagnosticId must be unique across analyzers

trans-unit.target: Diagnostic Id '{0}' is already used by analyzer '{1}'. Please use a different diagnostic ID.

trans-unit.source: DiagnosticId must be unique across analyzers.

trans-unit.target: Category '{0}' is not from the allowed categories specified in the file '{1}'

trans-unit.target: Invalid entry in analyzer category and diagnostic ID range specification file

trans-unit.target: Invalid entry '{0}' in analyzer category and diagnostic ID range specification file '{1}'

trans-unit.source: DiagnosticId for analyzers must be a non-null constant
trans-unit.target: DiagnosticId for analyzers must be a non-null constant

trans-unit.target: Diagnostic Id for rule '{0}' must be a non-null constant

trans-unit.source: Diagnostic analyzer types should not use types from Workspaces assemblies. Workspaces assemblies are only available when the analyzer executes in Visual Studio IDE live analysis, but are not available during command line build. Referencing types from Workspaces assemblies will lead to runtime exception during analyzer execution in command line build.
trans-unit.target: Diagnostic analyzer types should not use types from Workspaces assemblies. Workspaces assemblies are only available when the analyzer executes in Visual Studio IDE live analysis, but are not available during command line build. Referencing types from Workspaces assemblies will lead to runtime exception during analyzer execution in command line build.

trans-unit.source: Do not use types from Workspaces assembly in an analyzer
trans-unit.target: Do not use types from Workspaces assembly in an analyzer

trans-unit.source: Change diagnostic analyzer type '{0}' to remove all direct and/or indirect accesses to type(s) '{1}', which access type(s) '{2}'
trans-unit.target: Change diagnostic analyzer type '{0}' to remove all direct and/or indirect accesses to type(s) '{1}', which access type(s) '{2}'

trans-unit.source: Change diagnostic analyzer type '{0}' to remove all direct accesses to type(s) '{1}'
trans-unit.target: Change diagnostic analyzer type '{0}' to remove all direct accesses to type(s) '{1}'

trans-unit.source: MSBuildWorkspace has moved to the Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspaces.MSBuild NuGet package and there are breaking API changes.
trans-unit.target: MSBuildWorkspace has moved to the Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspaces.MSBuild NuGet package and there are breaking API changes.

trans-unit.source: Please upgrade MSBuildWorkspace by adding a package reference to the Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspaces.MSBuild NuGet package. See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=874285 for details on using MSBuildWorkspace successfully.
trans-unit.target: Please upgrade MSBuildWorkspace by adding a package reference to the Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspaces.MSBuild NuGet package. See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=874285 for details on using MSBuildWorkspace successfully.

trans-unit.source: Upgrade MSBuildWorkspace
trans-unit.target: Upgrade MSBuildWorkspace
